intro: Dregeochloa, commonly known as the African grass, is a genus of flowering plants in the grass family Poaceae. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and slender, often hairy blades. The plants typically grow in sandy or rocky soils and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Dregeochloa species are often used in ornamental horticulture due to their attractive, fine-textured foliage. They are also valued for their role in stabilizing soil and preventing erosion in degraded landscapes.
